title: Issues setting up custom domain and custom subdomain on Deta
body: Hey Deta Community, For the last few hours, I have been working on setting up a domain name I bought to point to a project on deta. I currently am trying to point api.duplexes.lol to one of my deta micros. I have been having some troubles with setting up the A records, and even when deta and the A records say it pointed to the right IP and is set up, I'm still unable to load the page. Through some testing, the only page I got to give a response(404 but closer!) was a URL that says it's not currently set up (www.duplexes.lol). Does anyone have any ideas? I'm using Cloudflare DNS and have attached some photos below. (Note the subdomain called
is in place of API just to try to figure this out.)
predicted_solution: Oh spoke to soon. www.duplexes.lol seems to work after it was turned to active but none of the other subdomains do? Bit strange. After some further testing I got https://www.cat.duplexes.lol/ to work with the following A record. https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1024918875151794177/1024921363795951636/unknown.png Image Seems that there has to be a www infront? Could I maybe get around this by creating a cname for every a record? An example would be like: A Record: www.cat 76.223.55.44 CNAME Record: cat www.cat.duplexes.lol

I couldn't find a way to do this looking at the docs: https://docs.deta.sh/docs/base/queries#equal Is there a way to do this that I missed?
predicted_solution: idea: store data in lower case, maybe in a separate field

';f=getattr(tokenize, '

'))' egg_info --egg-base /tmp/pip-install-uo3tuv20/psycopg2/pip-egg-info

    creating /tmp/pip-install-uo3tuv20/psycopg2/pip-egg-info/psycopg2.egg-info 
    writing /tmp/pip-install-uo3tuv20/psycopg2/pip-egg-info/psycopg2.egg-info/PKG-INFO 
    writing dependency_links to /tmp/pip-install-uo3tuv20/psycopg2/pip-egg-info/psycopg2.egg-info/dependency_links.txt 
    writing top-level names to /tmp/pip-install-uo3tuv20/psycopg2/pip-egg-info/psycopg2.egg-info/top_level.txt

    option.``` 
M1 Mac. I have already installed psycopg2 and postgres. which pg_configreturns: 
``` 
/opt/homebrew/opt/libpq/bin/pg_config 
```
date_time.predicted_solution: youve installed pg_config on your local system, but its not installed on your micro (and cannot be installed on your micro), which is why psycopg2 cannot be built from source while deploying

date_time.title: Is it possible to use Flet with Deta?
date_time.body: Hello all. Absolute noob ( in Deta and Web Development in general) here. I was just wondering Is it possible to use the Python library Flet with Deta? Like I ran the flask hello world in the Getting started tutorial in Deta docs and it worked just fine and changed the code in main.py to the following links code.  https://flet.dev/docs/ and changed the last line to  flet.app(target=main, view=flet.WEB_BROWSER) now after running deta deploy in the cmd it shows Successfully deployed changes but when I visit the site it shows Timeout Micro timed out. So in short my question is Is it possible to use Flet with Deta in any possible way or do have to stick with FastAPI, Flask or Starlette? Many thanks in advance. :deta_heart:
date_time.predicted_solution: tl;dr deta supports running ASGI/WSGI apps, like those built using fastapi or flask. flet doesnt look like an ASGI or WSGI framework, rather more geared toward mobile/desktop ui with an option to serve your app as a webpage, so its probably not possible to use it with deta. you can try asking in their discord server if you can run it like an ASGI or WSGI app. thats about all i can say

date_time.title: Bad Gateway
date_time.body: Hey, I am a new user, please can you help me to fix this? I am on windows and using Edge. and FastAPI. Bad Gatewa The micro ran into an error while processing the request. If you are the owner of the micro, please check your logs.
date_time.predicted_solution: Ok fixed it, here is what happened in case anyone else has this issue too.  Cause: my requirements.txt was not utf-8 encoded Fix: Creating a UTF-8 Encoded File - using Notepad++ Just select Encoding -> UTF-8 You can see the file encoding in the bottom right corner.

date_time.title: Task timeout
date_time.body: Hi all, I've deployed a Flask app, runs fine except when it has to send verification/registration emails. When I check the deta logs I see 'Task timed out after 10.00 seconds', using a custom domain, I've tried the SMTP credentials from the host provider...still nothing. When I run the app from localhost the emails send as they should. Any advice?
date_time.predicted_solution: Deta micros have a timeout of 10 seconds so a process taking more than 10 seconds won't work

date_time.title: Is there an limit to Deta Base
date_time.body: If for example, I would try to make TBs of data and save them in a deta base, would there be limitations, or would it be really slow? Would it work?
date_time.predicted_solution: each record in a base has a limit of 400kb and there are no explicit limits, but you can only fetch 1MB at a time and they'll probably politely ask you to move your data elsewhere if it reaches TBs
